name: Water Days – Author Discussion
description:
A community in tumultuous post-liberalization Bangalore grapples with an influx of northern immigrants and the mysterious death of Archana, a teenager involved with one of the migrants. 

Working with all the means and tools offered to a mature writer, Sundar Sarrukai depicts the overnight springing up of new neighborhoods and ways of living, new jobs, new migrations and growing tensions. We are given a sense of how untrammeled urbanization has turned the local administration rogue and uncaring. All along, men and women line up to collect water and stories in the dead of night. 

Join us to discuss the themes mentioned in this book with Sundar Sarrukai, author and Srikar Raghavan, writer and researcher.

name: Book Discussion : WATER DAYS with Sundar Sarukkai and Srikar Raghavan
description:
A community in tumultuous post-liberalization Bangalore grapples with an influx of northern immigrants and the mysterious death of Archana, a teenager involved with one of the migrants. 

Working with all the means and tools offered to a mature writer, Sundar Sarrukai depicts the overnight springing up of new neighborhoods and ways of living, new jobs, new migrations and growing tensions. name: Screening of Before Film Series by Richard Linklater - Before Sunset (2004)
description:
Join us over the long weekend for special screening of Before Sunrise (1995) and Before Sunset (2004) on Friday and Saturday night at Underline Center!

What is the Before series?

Richard Linklater’s trilogy of Before Sunrise, Before Sunset, and Before Midnight tells the heartfelt, surprising tale of the joys and pains of modern love.

The films, starring Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy, follow the evolving relationship of Jesse and Celine over a period of 18 years. Each film is set about nine years apart, capturing different stages of their lives and relationship. It’s widely considered one the greatest film trilogies, and is notable for its extensive use of dialogue, with conversations driving the narrative and exploring themes of love, time, and relationships. The films are characterized by long, intimate conversations between the main characters, which often delve into their thoughts, feelings, and philosophies.

name: Manga Reading Room with Ishan
description:
We’re starting a manga library and reading room!

Come enjoy a quiet environment where you can browse and read from our collection of manga, and connect with fellow enthusiasts from the community.

If you’ve never read manga before and are just curious about the hype, this is a great place to start!

Please note: Books cannot be borrowed or taken outside the library. Since these are from a personal collection, access is limited to the duration of the event.
Who is Ishan?

Ishan is an avid manga reader, game master, and all-around fandom enthusiast. He wants more people to fall in love with the things he loves, and this event is his way of sharing his large manga collection with the community.

name: Improv Essentials: A Crash Course by Improv Lore
description:
Want to improvise but keep missing our Level 1 intensive? Learn the basics in our crash course!

We’ll take you from no performing experience to loving the stage
What we’ll cover:

    Basic stagecraft

    Trusting your ideas

    Working (playing) well with others

    Short-form improv games

    An introduction to longform improv

What you get:

    6 hours of workshop

    Access to select cast-only jams

    A discount on the next Level 1 intensive

Schedule:

Day 1: Saturday, 16th August - 11am to 2pm
Day 2: Sunday, 17th August - 11am to 2pm

name: Yoga with Sisters & Misters
description:
Yoga - With the Sisters and Misters
PLEASE BRING YOUR OWN MATS :))
Progressive Vinyasa classes with Chanchal are a blend of breath work, strong but approachable flow, mindful postural focus, and deep soothing support.
Classes cultivate balance, stability, flexibility, mobility and vigor as the asana ebbs and flows between effort and ease.
Students can expect a mix of both traditional lineage based practices & progressive movement intended for modern bodies and demands.
Yoga Instructor: Chanchal
Meeting time: 8:15 
Meeting Point: CCD Square
For any further queries contact
Vaishnavi- 6380349608

name: Visible Mending 101
description:
You can bring something you’d like to mend, or practice on fabric scraps as we explore simple techniques like darning, and patchwork.

Visible mending shows that repairing is not just practical, but beautiful. It's a way to care for our clothes, extend their life, and add a touch of personality and colour along the way.

All materials will be provided, but feel free to bring your own garment to work on.

name: Zines for Safer Futures
description:
✨ Zine-making x Safe Futures ✨

What does safety feel like?
A hand to hold, a route you trust, a number you always text.
This workshop is a space to remember, reimagine, and reclaim.

We’re bringing back #TextWhenYouGetHome, not just as a phrase, but as a movement.

Through scissors, glue, stories, and stillness, we’ll make zines that hold the textures of our experiences and futures we want to shape.
Come reflect, create, and connect.

🎨 No art skills needed
🧵 Just show up with your stories, your feelings, your questions

👀 Limited spots. Link in bio to sign up

name: Desi Breakfast Club
description:
From the deep, masala-laden bite of Bedmi Poori to the indulgent fluff of Chole Bhature, every plate is a page from a desi breakfast diary.

Craving something richer? Keema Pav brings the heat. And the Parathas? Stuffed, griddled, and made exactly the way they should be — with love, ghee, and no shortcuts.

This isn’t a meal. It’s a morning well spent.

Now Serving Desi Breakfast only at Treat.
Every Sunday 09:30 am - 11:30 am

PLEASE NOTE: We have two time slots available for the Desi Breakfast Club:

Slot 1 - 09:30 AM - 10:15 AM
Slot 2 - 10:30 AM - 11:15 AM

- Once you send in your reservation request, our team will get in touch to confirm your preferred timing. If your chosen slot is full, we’ll happily offer you the next available one.

- To reserve your spot, we’re charging a small fee of ₹200 per person—which is fully redeemable against your meal. You’re free to choose anything from the menu, and if your bill goes over, you can simply settle the difference at the restaurant.

Can’t wait to see you at the Desi Breakfast Club ☀️
